intro: Brassica montana, commonly known as the alpine cabbage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like broccoli and mustard. This plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Brassica montana features rosettes of thick, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in the spring. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and visual interest.
